傳亨利伯金韋拉偕Spotify老細買起槍手

【Now Sports】阿仙奴球迷向來不喜歡班主高安基，傳奇球星亨利、伯金、韋拉或許可以成為救世主。
英國《太陽報》報道，亨利、伯金（Dennis Bergkamp）、韋拉正準備與身家超過30億鎊的瑞典富豪Daniel Ek合作，從高安基手上收購阿仙奴。一旦易手成功，3大名宿很大機會以管理層身份回歸兵工廠。

Daniel Ek早前於Twitter已經宣佈希望入主阿仙奴：「我從小時候已經為阿仙奴歡呼喝采，如果高安基體育及娛樂公司希望出售球會，我非常願意爭奪。」他在2008年成立了線上音樂平台Spotify，現時市值約580億鎊。

在早前的歐洲超級聯賽風波中，亨利曾經公開批評高安基體育及娛樂公司：「我不再認識這家球會了，他們把阿仙奴當作公司去管理，不是球會，欠缺對於足球核心價值的認知。」

Arsenal transfer news: Gunners keen on Real Betis star

Arsenal are reportedly on the hunt for an attacking midfielder with the Gunners interested in Real Betis' Nabil Fekir.

What's the latest news involving Fekir?

The Daily Mail has reported that Mikel Arteta's side are interested in signing an attacking midfielder this summer.

Nabil Fekir is being taken under consideration, as well as Borussia Dortmund's Julian Brandt.

The Frenchman has previously been targeted by Arsenal, as well as Liverpool, and it seems that the Gunners may make another attempt to lure Fekir to the Emirates in the coming transfer window.

How has he performed this season?

The 27-year-old has been a stand-out performer for Betis this year and his WhoScored statistics certainly reflect this.

Out of the entire Betis squad, Fekir has achieved the highest average rating of 7.10. The attacking midfielder has also provided nine goal contributions across 29 La Liga appearances.

Fekir has also unleashed an average of 2.8 shots and completes 2.6 dribbles per league fixture.

That works out at 76 dribbles in total, meaning he's completed more in his respective top flight than Borussia Dortmund's Jadon Sancho, Lyon's Memphis Depay, and Newcastle's Allan Saint-Maximin this season.

Could he be an Odegaard alternative for Arsenal?

Although Martin Odegaard has thrived during his time in north London and was named Arsenal's Player of the Month for March, Fekir could be another option for the Gunners.

Since his January arrival, the Norwegian has proven that he's capable of performing in the Premier League and Arsenal are reportedly very keen on signing Odegaard permanently.

However, according to the Daily Star, Arsenal now face competition for the Real Madrid man, creating doubt over a long-term deal.

Fekir - who Transfermarkt value at £22.5m - operates in a similar capacity to Odegaard, taking up the space just behind the centre-forward and bringing creativity and goals to the team from the tip of midfield.

What other positions do Arsenal need to strengthen this summer?

This season has highlighted that Arsenal are in need of an out-and-out striker.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang was in scintillating form last year and scored 22 Premier League goals. However, this season the 31-year-old has failed to replicate the same level of goal-scoring form.

Furthermore, Alexandre Lacazette's contract is set to expire next summer, and football.london has reported that it's likely the forward will depart in the coming months.

Mikel Arteta also needs to strengthen at right-back. Hector Bellerin has only made one Premier League appearance since the end of February.

In his absence, Calum Chambers has filled the void but having spent much of his career playing at centre-half, it feels like little more than a short-term solution.

If Arsenal can bring in a No.10, a right-back and a striker this summer, they'll be much better placed for 2021/22.

PSG consider move for Arsenal 26yo this summer

Paris Saint-Germain want to bring in a new right-back this summer, with the French media naming Hector Bellerin among their possible targets.

L’Equipe report that Paris Saint-Germain are planning a revamp in their right-back position this summer. They have Florenzi on loan with an option to buy, but currently, they aren’t happy with the player and don’t want to activate that option.

That opens up the possibility of new signings, with Tottenham Hotspur’s Serge Aurier and Arsenal’s Hector Bellerin among the reported list of options.

Aurier obviously has a history with PSG boss Mauricio Pochettino at Spurs, as well as having played for PSG for three seasons earlier in his career. He’ll only have a year left on his Tottenham contract this summer.

But Bellerin is being very strongly linked with a departure from Arsenal this summer, and PSG made a vague attempt to sign him in 2020 before it became clear the two clubs’ valuations were so far apart.

With PSG on the hunt for a right-back again and Arsenal a little more willing to sell, perhaps things will be different this time around.

The S*n link Arsenal takeover bid to rising Spotify prices

Daniel Ek hasn’t even made his bid for Arsenal and The S*n are already trying to link his move with a price rise at Spotify.

On Friday, Daniel Ek tweeted that he would be open to buying Arsenal. On Monday, Spotify announced they were raising their prices, prompting some in the media to draw an unfair and downright spurious connection.

The entire S*n ‘article’ is based on nothing more than tweets from Arsenal fans, with a few Chelsea fans thrown in to try and generate extra controversy.

There is absolutely no link between the two matters with the Spotify price rise no doubt in the works for longer than just this weekend.

Most people will know this, still, the headline on The S*n’s website was annoying. Along with the Mail they do this sort of thing all the time, linking two unrelated issues to generate an outrage headline knowing most people won’t even read the article. And while the response of many is ‘just don’t read The S*n of Mail’, a sentiment I heartily encourage, too many people already do to just ignore them.

Ek is reportedly in talks with Thierry Henry, Partick Vieira, and Dennis Bergkamp about forming a consortium to buy Arsenal from Stan Kroenke. As amazing as that sounds, I’m keeping my party hat in the closet for now.

Silent Stan has shown no indication that he wants to sell, nor does he seem bothered in the slightest that he’s hated.

艾馬利：阿迪達阿仙奴完美婚姻

【Now Sports】雖然間接被阿迪達踢走，但教練艾馬利仍然十分大方，盛讚對方與阿仙奴屬於天作之合。
阿仙奴在2018年辭退執教了18個月的艾馬利（Unai Emery），由前隊長阿迪達接手，但整體戰績仍然沒有太大起色。艾馬利現時帶領維拉利爾，將於周四歐霸盃4強重遇前東家。

「阿迪達和阿仙奴，這是一段美好的婚姻。」艾馬利說。「他正在球會貼上自己的印記，從他們的比賽風格裡，很容易看出他正在恢復阿仙奴踢漂亮足球的傳統。他曾在雲加麾下踢球，我相信他能運用所學到的一切。」

艾馬利認為，阿迪達在坐正之前曾擔任曼城主帥哥迪奧拿的副手多年，有助為自己定位：「現在他於兵工廠獲得機會，那是一個能讓他好好發展的地方，因為他深受阿仙奴的喜愛。」

圖片來源 : ©AFP

Report: Mikel Arteta tells Edu to sign 'outstanding' player to replace Arsenal star Leno

According to a report from La Razon, Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta has instructed his side to make a summer move for Bilbao shot-stopper Unai Simon.

The Spaniard, still only 23, has made a brilliant name for himself in La Liga. He has earned six international caps for Spain as well, getting a place over Manchester United star David de Gea.

Arteta has reportedly had enough of Bernd Leno’s errors in goal. The German made a howler against Everton on Friday, and his mistakes are costing Arsenal dearly.

The Gunners boss wants to eradicate that next season, and he has reportedly told Edu to dive into the summer transfer window to sign Simon from Bilbao.

Spain boss Luis Enrique labelled Simon as ‘outstanding’, while Germany and Bayern Munich superstar Manuel Neuer also heaped praise on him after the nations league game between the two countries back in November. (El Desmarque)

At just 23 years of age, Simon is already among the best goalkeepers in La Liga. It wouldn’t be a surprise at all to see him secure a big move this summer, but whether it will be to Arsenal is a whole different story.

Leno does have an occasional error in him, but he is still a fantastic goalkeeper. The German has saved us time and time again over the last two years, but his mistakes are a lot more memorable to fans than his brilliant saves.

The big problem for Leno at the moment is the lack of competition. As good as Maty Ryan is, we all know he isn’t going to replace the German. That may have made him a tiny bit complacent, which is showing on the pitch.

If Arsenal bring in another top-quality goalkeeper this summer, Leno will have no choice but to be at his absolute best every single day. The fear of losing your spot brings out the best in every player, and the German is no different.

Simon would fit that role perfectly. The Spaniard is more than capable of replacing Leno, and his arrival will surely raise the level of our goalkeepers next season. If Arteta and Edu can get him in, it would be silly not to.

Man Utd join Arsenal in race for Slavia Prague starlet Abdallah Sima

Manchester United are the latest side to register their interest in 19-year-old Slavia Prague sensation Abdallah Sima, who has been making waves for the Czech side this season.

Sima only made his senior debut for Slavia back in September 2020 but has already blossomed into one of the team's best players. He has bagged 15 goals and six assists in 29 appearances this year, including strikes against the likes of Leicester City and Nice in the Europa League.

His form has caught the eye of a number of sides. Everton were credited with an interest in February, while Eurosport believe Arsenal and West Ham have been pushing hard for his signature, and now the Manchester Evening News state that United have thrown their hat in the ring.

United have recently focused on signing football's highest-rated teenagers, with club officials happy to spend big fees in the hope that a handful of those youngsters turn into £100m-rated players.

Amad Diallo is the highest-profile example, but the likes of Hannibal Mejbri and Facundo Pellistri are two of several big-money signings which have bolstered United's academy in recent years.

Scouts have identified Sima as a potential target. The towering Senegalese winger has spent most of his career out on the right but is expected to transition into a centre-forward in the future - one of many reasons why he has been compared to Arsenal legend Thierry Henry.

Because of the UK's exit from the European Union, any player joining from a European side must be awarded a Governing Body Endorsement before they can join an English team. The rules are designed to stop English sides hoarding foreign talent, but Sima's pedigree as a first-team star already means he would likely receive a GBE for a move to England.

Earlier this year, West Ham midfielder Tomas Soucek admitted he had urged his club to sign Sima, who was rumoured to come with a £35m price tag.

Slavia president Jaroslav Tvrdik took to Twitter to label the rumour as 'not true', but whether he was referring to the fee or the Hammers' interest is unclear.

Should United sign Sima, it would give them a complete overload of young forwards. Amad, Shola Shoretire and Anthony Elanga are all on the cusp of breakthroughs in the hope of battling 19-year-old Mason Greenwood for a spot in the first team, so adding Sima might cause a headache or two.

Injured Arsenal star returns to training pre-Villarreal clash

David Luiz has returned to training ahead of Arsenal’s clash with Villarreal on Thursday, hoping to prove his fitness ahead of the first leg.

The Evening Standard report that Arsenal have been handed a boost by David Luiz’s return to training this week. The centre-back is back involved after his injury in March required minor surgery to repair.

It doesn’t seem like there are any guarantees Luiz will be ready to start, but the report suggests he’s “looking to prove his fitness ahead of the game in Spain”.

The most encouraging thing is that Luiz’s potential involvement in the first leg suggests he’ll very likely be ready for the second leg. That’s the game Arsenal really need their best defence available to avoid conceding any away goals.

As for Luiz’s contract situation, with his deal expiring this summer, Standard Sport report that talks have yet to take place, but both Arsenal and the player himself are open to changing that this summer.

It seems they aren’t going to make any decisions until the current campaign is over.

Luiz has played in five wins, one draw and one defeat in Arsenal’s Europa League campaign so far. He’s been a regular starter under Mikel Arteta in the big games, and would surely return to the starting lineup as soon as he’s ready.

quote.msg:
Report: Mikel Arteta tells Edu to sign 'outstanding' player to replace Arsenal star Leno

According to a report from La Razon, Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta has instructed his side to make a summer move for Bilbao shot-stopper Unai Simon.

The Spaniard, still only 23, has made a brilliant name for himself in La Liga. He has earned six international caps for Spain as well, getting a place over Manchester United star David de Gea.

Arteta has reportedly had enough of Bernd Leno’s errors in goal. The German made a howler against Everton on Friday, and his mistakes are costing Arsenal dearly.

The Gunners boss wants to eradicate that next season, and he has reportedly told Edu to dive into the summer transfer window to sign Simon from Bilbao.

Spain boss Luis Enrique labelled Simon as ‘outstanding’, while Germany and Bayern Munich superstar Manuel Neuer also heaped praise on him after the nations league game between the two countries back in November. (El Desmarque)

At just 23 years of age, Simon is already among the best goalkeepers in La Liga. It wouldn’t be a surprise at all to see him secure a big move this summer, but whether it will be to Arsenal is a whole different story.

Leno does have an occasional error in him, but he is still a fantastic goalkeeper. The German has saved us time and time again over the last two years, but his mistakes are a lot more memorable to fans than his brilliant saves.

The big problem for Leno at the moment is the lack of competition. As good as Maty Ryan is, we all know he isn’t going to replace the German. That may have made him a tiny bit complacent, which is showing on the pitch.

If Arsenal bring in another top-quality goalkeeper this summer, Leno will have no choice but to be at his absolute best every single day. The fear of losing your spot brings out the best in every player, and the German is no different.

Simon would fit that role perfectly. The Spaniard is more than capable of replacing Leno, and his arrival will surely raise the level of our goalkeepers next season. If Arteta and Edu can get him in, it would be silly not to.
